function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Local SMEs in the ICT sector are overlooked for opportunities in data collection, storage, and computation, which are mostly handled by large corporations in smart cities.","Impact":"Deprivation of opportunities for local SMEs to expand their scopes and showcase their potential, leading to economic and social marginalization.","Mitigation":"Promotion of inclusive policies and collaboration between local SMEs and large corporations to ensure equal access to opportunities and resources.","Technologies":"Data sharing platforms, collaborative tools, and open data initiatives.","People":"Local SMEs in the ICT sector.","Owner":"Government and industry associations."},{"Description":"Digital non-taxation regimes in different countries benefit large corporations, depriving local SMEs in the ICT sector of fair competition and market access.","Impact":"Undermining the competitiveness of local SMEs and hindering their growth and sustainability in the market.","Mitigation":"Advocacy for fair taxation policies and international cooperation to address loopholes in digital taxation regimes.","Technologies":"Blockchain for transparent financial transactions, digital tax compliance tools, and international tax cooperation platforms.","People":"Local SMEs in the ICT sector, tax authorities, and international regulatory bodies.","Owner":"Industry associations, tax authorities, and international organizations."},{"Description":"Post-COVID-19 stimulus packages and strategies favor the embrace of new digital technologies, potentially creating a competitive advantage for larger politico-financed competitors over local SMEs in the ICT sector.","Impact":"Further marginalization of local SMEs and limited access to resources, hindering their ability to compete in the evolving digital landscape.","Mitigation":"Support for local SMEs through targeted stimulus measures, capacity-building programs, and access to innovation funds.","Technologies":"Digital innovation funds, capacity-building platforms, and innovation hubs.","People":"Local SMEs in the ICT sector, government bodies, and industry stakeholders.","Owner":"Government and industry development agencies."}]}
